snippet: A disparity in employment based on education that had been growing since the 1980s accelerated in the recession and the recovery.
abstract: Georgetown University study shows that Americans with no more than a high school education have continued to lose jobs during the recovery from the recession, shedding 200,000 jobs from early 2010 to early 2012, while better educated people have gained millions of jobs.
lead_paragraph: A disparity in employment based on education that had been growing since the 1980s accelerated in the recession and the recovery.

headline.seo: Job Losses Persist for the Less-Educated
headline.main: Job Losses Persist for the Less-Educated
headline.print_headline: Job Losses Persist for the Less-Educated
